column4: what tools do I need to write c# / c++ code and compile it running ubuntu?
gcc for c++, for c# you'll need mono. other than that, any old text editor will work
okay, so gcc and mono is compilers too?
mono is the .NET runtime for linux. i forget the compiler's name. you can search in synaptic
who is evil enough to run non-free software?
itd  be unethical and immoral =
yet phishing sites still exist
oh you mean running proprietary software?
it could be a bash script.. not closed, can be read fine...except for the bit where most people cant read bash scripts
well the repos are being checked for malicious code
which is why i say to use them
oh :D then I guess we agree on every point

but you could find a script online or get an email that tells you to run something...and if you're gullible do it... and even if that script is human readable, it may not be readable to *you* as the user if its in a language you dont know
youre right, you must have the assumption of that the general public being more or less stupid =)
ignorant, not stupid. ignorance is curable (ie, they could /learn/ to read scripts and code)
truetrue
it seems that doesnt grab all dependencies, as I guess LinuxGuy2009 ran taht
it wont grab ones already installed. thats why i said start at a minimal install
ah, but there must be a way to do it without installing  a new system
vm?
still
there are tools to get dependency graphs. could feed one of those into aptitude's --download-only
run man xrandr
that was ment for demoneye; run man xrandr
